news_header: Professor Mikko Hallman received the Nordic Medical Prize for his significant contributions to neonatal care.
news_text: The Nordic Medical Prize was awarded to Professor Mikko Hallman from the University of Oulu for his extensive work on babies and newborns, particularly in improving treatment for premature respiratory distress syndrome. The €20,000 prize, given annually by the Finnish Foundation for Medicine, recognizes important medical contributions. Hallman's research has led to better survival rates for smaller infants, and he has held prestigious positions in paediatrics at the University of California and the Central Hospital of Helsinki. The award committee chair, Katriina Aalto-Setälä, noted Hallman's significant impact on paediatric medicine and his influence on future generations of doctors. The award ceremony will take place on January 23 at the Helsinki Medical Day, and the prize has been awarded since 1981.
